titles.title: Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" / Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus"

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" (fols. 3ra-91ra) I-1) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fols. 3ra-7rb) I-2a) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary": 1 miracle (fols. 7va-8rb) I-3) Introductive exhortation and hymn (fols. 9ra-11va) I-2b) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary": 60 miracles (fols. 12ra-90rb) I-4) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wä-ʾǝweddǝsäki ... "I worship Thee ..." (fols. 90rb-91ra) II) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus" (fol. 92ra-120va) II-1) ʾƎsäggǝd lä-mäläkotǝkä... "I worship Thy Godhead ..." (fols. 92ra-95ra) II-2) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus": 18 miracles (fols. 95ra-120va), incomplete
Additiones 1-2.

copyists.copyist: Wäldä Muse is mentioned as the scribe of Texts I-1, I-2 and I-3 on fol. 8rb.

donors.donor: The name of the original donor, Täklä Mikaʾel (?), has been erased throughout Text I-2b. Zärʾa Krǝstos is mentioned in Text I-3 (fol. 9ra). The following persons are mentioned throughout Text II: Wälättä Giyorgis, Täsfa Giyorgis, Wälättä Kidan, Gäbrä Kidan.

dcomments.dcomment: The scribe Wäldä Muse was active in the second half of the 19th century; he was a contemporary of King Yoḥannǝs IV (r. 1872-89) and Metropolitan ʾAtnatewos (in tenure 1869-76) (cp. AGM-009, MR-004, MR-006, MR-007, MR-023, UM-023). Quires XIII-XVII are of more recent time.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. was resewn. At least one folio is missing in quire XIII. Half of fol. 2 is cut off.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (4 tools were used: line fillet, double circle, double sine wave, cross hatching).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. Quires A, XIII and XVII are reinforced with parchment guards.

inks.ink: Black, red (hands a and b: strong red, hand c: vivid red, hand d: vivid crimson).

squires.squire:
A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(6/fols. 3r-8v) – II(3; s.l.: 1, stub after 3/fol. 9r-11v) – III(8/fols. 12r-19v) – IV(8/fols. 20r-27v) – V(8; s.l.: 4, stub after 5; 5, stub after 4/fols. 28r-35v) – VI(8/fols. 36r-43v) – VII(8/fols. 44r-51v) – VIII (8/fols. 52r-59v) – IX(8/fols. 60r-67v) – X(8/fols. 68r-75v) – XI(8/fols. 76r-83v) – XII(8/fols. 84r-91v) – <XIII (5/fols. 92r-96v) – XIV(6/fols. 97r-102v) – XV(6/fols. 103r-108v) – XVI(6/fols. 109r-114v) – XVII(7; s.l.: 7, no stub/fols. 115r-121v)>.
The structure of quire XIII cannot be identified as most of the leaves are detached from their counterparts; at least one folio is missing. Quires XIII-XVII were added later.

taunit.mr-info: Text area I: 3ra-8rb. All data are for fol. 4r.
taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Occasionally the horizontal lines are of Type A (e.g., fol. 11rv) or Type B (e.g., fols. 4r-8v, 14v-18v).

taunit.mr-info: Text area II: 9ra-11va. All data are for fol. 11r.
taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Occasionally the horizontal lines are of Type A (e.g., fol. 11rv) or Type B (e.g., fols. 4r-8v, 14v-18v).

taunit.mr-info: Text area III: 12ra-91ra. All data are for fol. 13r.
taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Occasionally the horizontal lines are of Type A (e.g., fol. 11rv) or Type B (e.g., fols. 4r-8v, 14v-18v).

taunit.mr-info: Text area IV: 92ra-120va. All data are for fol. 94r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: mediocre. Hand b: mediocre. Hand c: poor and careless. Hand d: irregular.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a (Wäldä Muse): 3ra-8rb (Texts I-1, I-2a). The handwriting appears hastily executed with right-sloping letters of angular shape. Some letters have forked hook vowel markers (e.g., በ, ኀ, ን, ገ) the vowel marker of እ is notably long. Hand b: 9ra-11va (Texts I-3). The script is characterized by angular, broadly spaced and irregularly slanted letters. Most of the letters have hairlines. The letter ለ is formed in a peculiar shape. Hand c: 12ra-91ra (Texts I-2b, I-4). The handwriting appears very uneven and irregular. Hand d: 92ra-120va (Text II). It is difficult to determine whether one or more scribes were involved in writing (cp. fols. 108rb, 109vb, 110vb).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of donors in Texts I-3 and II; groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1 and I-2b; incipit of all other texts, incipit of sections of Texts I-2b and II-2; section numbers of Text I-2b; titles of miracles written in the upper margin of Text I-2b; the word ʾǝsäggǝd "I worship" in Text II-1; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

otherdetails.otherdetail:
All miracles of St. Mary are numbered.
Text I-3 includes the hymn: - ʾƎsäggǝd läki ʾo-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Maryam Mariham ʾǝmmu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos kähali ... "I worship Thee, O my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother of Jesus Christ the Almighty ..." (fols. 10va-11va).

additional.cont: Fol. 2ra: Note referring to commissioning or purchase of the Ms. (?)
additional.det: The note is written in hand c; some words (names) have been erased. Its content is not quite clear. The note states that the book has been bought by a person probably called Täklä Mikaʾel (the same name might has been erased throughout the main text) with the church's money. The one who has commissioned the writing was ʾabba Ṗakwǝmis. The names of the abbot and priests have been erased.

additional.cont: Fol. 121v: Unidentified text referring to Jesus Christ.
additional.det: The text is barely legible due to faded ink and erasures.

extras.extra: - The scribe of Text II (hand d) often disregarded the ruling lines. - Titles of some miracles of St. Mary (until the 37th miracle, fol. 53) are written in the upper margins, in red. - Corrections are written over erasures: e.g., fols. 29vb, 35ra, 47rb, 77rb, 86vb. - Spaces for rubricated names of St Mary or the donors are left unfilled: fols. 38va, 41rab, 48ra, 50va. - Crude ornamental bands: fols. 3r, 90rb, 91ra. - Scribbles: fol. 1v.
